story:
Assalamu alaikum, sweet Muslimah! Here's a bedtime story just for you:

Once upon a time, in a small village surrounded by lush green forests and sparkling rivers, there lived a kind and gentle lamb named Fatimah. Fatimah loved nothing more than playing with her friends in the meadows, chasing butterflies, and listening to the sounds of the nightingales singing in the trees.

As the sun began to set, Fatimah's mother, a wise and loving goat named Najma, would call out to her to come home for the night. But Fatimah loved to linger, watching the stars twinkling in the sky and listening to the stories of the old wise woman of the village, Umm Ali.

Umm Ali would sit under the moonlight, surrounded by the soft rustling of leaves and the chirping of crickets, and tell tales of courage, kindness, and wisdom. She would speak of the Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him, and the blessings he brought to the world. She would speak of the rewards of good deeds and the forgiveness of Allah for those who sought it.

One night, as Fatimah was getting older, Umm Ali took her aside and said, "Fatimah, my dear, it is time for you to learn about the prayer. It is the special way that Muslims connect with Allah, their Creator, and ask for guidance, forgiveness, and protection."

Umm Ali taught Fatimah how to make the movements of the prayer, how to bow her head, how to put her forehead on the ground, and how to say the words of the prayer. Fatimah felt a sense of closeness to Allah and a sense of peace that she had never felt before.

As the nights went by, Fatimah would join her mother and the other animals in the village for prayer. Together, they would worship Allah, asking for His blessings and guidance. And as they prayed, Fatimah felt the beauty of Islam surrounding her, filling her heart with love and light.

As you sleep, my dear, I want you to remember Fatimah and the stories of Umm Ali. May Allah bless you with a heart full of faith, a soul full of kindness, and a mind full of wisdom. May you always remember to pray to Allah, to seek His forgiveness and guidance, and to be a guiding light for those around you.

And so, my dear, as you drift off to sleep, I whisper in your ear: "Inna al-Husna bi-ka ya Muhammad" â€“ "Truly, good is your Lord, full of mercy." May Allah have mercy on you and guide you on your journey through this life and into the next.

Sleep tight, my dear Muslimah. May your slumber be peaceful and your dreams filled with the mercy and blessings of Allah.
